content.description:
Shades of Gray (SOG) is a nice, casual two pitch outing--one of the few multi-pitch routes in Logan Canyon and, along with it's neighbor, Dreamsicle, perhaps the best. Dreamsicle and SOG share the first 1.5 pitches.

Pitch 1: About 8 bolts. Start at bottom of the slot and stay left. Shares the first (about) 5 bolts with Chain Reaction, but moves left into a right facing dihedral, which it follows to the rightmost edge of the party ledge. 2 bolt belay.

Pitch 2: About 7 bolts. Climb up and left to two bolt anchor at top of wall. SOG and Dreamsicle share the first 4 or 5 bolts of the second pitch. Stay left

60 Meter rope is sufficient if done as two pitches. Recommend rapping straight down from pitch 2 anchor and climbing Razzmatazz, or hanging out on the party ledge.
content.protection: 2 pitches. About 8 bolts each, plus anchors.

content.description: Nice 5.11 face strait down from the Shades of Gray (SOG) upper anchors on great rock. Climb SOG to the party ledge, then traverse out to the left onto the party ledge proper. There’s a single bolt at the base as a belay bolt. You can also clip the first bolt on the climb if you want a second bolt clipped for a belay. Rap off from either Jericolor or SOG anchors. You can also get to this climb by topping out on Jericolor

From the ground, this is a 35m route. Or climb the first 15m and belay from the first anchor shared with Brown Noser, then the business pitch is only 20m. The climb has two variations, making it either 12b or 13a.

Pitch 0.5: Climb easy terrain past one bolt up middle slot and belay at double bolt anchor 15m.

Pitch 1: 12b if you cut left to significantly easier climbing after clipping the second to last bolt (12c for shorter folk). If you stay slightly right of the bolt line the whole way up expect 13a climbing. After about 20 feet of suspect rock, the rock quality is some of the best in Logan Canyon. Difficult movement on small crimps up a slightly overhanging wall.

Named after one of Kat's favorite TV shows.

Perhaps the best 5.10 in Logan Canyon! It has consistent, clean climbing up great rock. Climb obvious, clean black streak on the right side of the wall. Despite the grade, this is a proud 5.10 lead. 70m rope required! A 70 will get you about 6 feet off the ground (last little bit is an easy down climb).

Nice mid-10 with a non-obvious sequence at the crux. To get to the base of the route, scramble up slot in middle of the wall then cut right below a giant flake. Belay on sweet 5’x5’ ledge 35 feet up on the right (has belay bolt). A 70 meter rope will get you from the belay ledge, to the top, then back to the ground.

Named after my teenage daughter’s favorite word, which fits this climb well. Climbing is okay, rock quality isn’t very good, though it will clean up with more traffic. I might add a belay in the middle to split this into two pitches, otherwise, with a 70 meter rope you’ll have to down climb the last 15 feet (5.6) or swing over and down climb from the Nerdy by Nature ledge (5.2)

Extension to Brown Eyed Girl on Wall of Jerico, taking it to the top of the wall. From the top of this route you can easily summit to the Party Ledge, thus connecting the Wall of Jericho to the Wall of Colors. On the Party Ledge there’s a single belay bolt at the base of Razzmatazz (immediately right of the large pyramid-shaped block on Party Ledge. It’s also easy to clip the first bolt on Razzmatazz if you want a second anchor point).
content.location: Extension to Brown Eyed Girl on Wall of Jerico, connecting to Wall of Colors

content.description:
Perhaps the best multi-pitch route in Logan Canyon (not too many to choose from so don't get too excited). Shares first 1.5 pitches with Shades of Gray (see that description), but cuts right 1/2 way up the second pitch to a shared anchor with Chain Reaction.

A 70m rope will get you from the first pitch, to the top, then back down to the ground.
content.protection: Two pitches, about 8 bolts each, plus anchors.

content.description: Nice, long 5.11 route on reasonably good rock. Shares start with Shades of Gray/Dreamsicle and shares the end of Dreamsicle. Stay right after about the 5th clip. The middle is nice, tricky 5.11 climbing. A 70 meter rope will get you from the ground, to the top, then back down to the SOG Pitch 1 anchors. Named for cataclysmic rock fall experienced while cleaning the route.

This is really a 30m single pitch route, with a short, easy approach pitch.

Pitch 0.5: Climb easy terrain past one bolt up middle slot and belay at double chain anchor 40 feet up.

Pitch 1: After surmounting a 20 foot band of suspect rock, the climbing is really fun. Liebacks, underclings and unusual but fun 5.11 movement get you to a final, difficult few moves and the anchors.

A 70m rope will get you from the top back down to the pitch 0.5 anchors.
